metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8311 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Potential heap based buffer overflow in ParseJSS in VideoLAN VLC before2.2.5 due to skipping NULL terminator in an input string allows attackersto execute arbitrary code via a crafted subtitles file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8311` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
libvlccore7 - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
vlc - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
vlc-data - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
vlc-nox - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
vlc-plugin-pulse - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.3').
